channel.title: [Python] Basics of creating a IRC bot
channel.description:
Okay, something I know most people would like to do is create a IRC bot, Yes! a real live IRC bot. First you need to download the IRClibrary from [url=http://python-irclib.sourceforge.net/]http://python-irclib.sourceforge.net/[/url] and stick the Python source/compiled file(s) in the file called "Lib" in your Python directory. Then start a new source file and do
[CODE] import irclib
network = 'SERVER IP' port = 6667 # Default Port channel = '#CHANNEL NAME' nick = 'NICKNAME' name = 'NAME'
irc = irclib.IRC() # Creates the IRC object server = irc.server() # Creates the Server object server.connect ( network, port, nick, ircname = name ) # Connects server.join ( channel ) # Joins the selected channel
irc.process_forever() # Take a guess? A loop. :-)
[/CODE]
The above will connect and join the defined channel and then just stick in there and do absolutly nothing :-)
Here is a list of a few methods you can do, basic of course
[CODE] server.privmsg('Channel or Nickname', 'Message') server.nick('New Nickname') server.kick('Channel', 'User', 'reason') server.oper('User', 'Password') [/CODE]
A fairly basic tutorial but if you want to do something like such you need to start low dont you? :-)
